newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Autoliv eyes front airbag sales to VW.
newsitem.headline: Autoliv eyes front airbag sales to VW.

text.p: Swedish car safety equipment maker Autoliv said the groundwork was now laid to seek sales of front impact air bags for cars to Volkswagen.
Autoliv earlier Thursday announced that it had signed its first deal with Volkswagen, for the supply of side air bags, but it was hoping to expand on this arrangement.

"Our problem has been that we have not had a steering wheel producer and Volkswagen wants to buy their anti-crash airbags already installed in steering wheels," Autoliv spokesman Mats Odman told Reuters.
"But through the purchase of French Isodelta (the third largest manufacturer of steering wheels in Europe) this problem is solved."
Odman said currently Volkswagen buys anti-crash airbags from the fourth largest business in Europe, Magna.
Autoliv is the largest company in the market with a 40 percent market share.
Delivering side impact airbags to Volkswagen is strategically important for Autoliv.
"Apart from the breakthrough at Volkswagen, this means the side impact airbag will soon become standard also in volume cars," Odman said.
"So far side airbags have only been placed in extremely safety orientated cars, like Volvo and Mercedes."
Autoliv said side airbags are to become standard in Volkswagen's Golf and Passat models for the Scandinavian and German market. In other markets the side airbag will come extra.
"The side impact airbag costs less than half of what a front imact airbag costs," Odman said.
